description: Erection of single storey extension with canopies to rear (East) to provide additional classrooms, hall, swimming pool and associated accommodation, canopy extension to North West side of main building  and 5 small ancillary buildings , external alterations to part of existing building, formation of staff car parking area (22 spaces, 2 of which are disabled) at East end of site with access off Vallis Way, alterations and use of existing parking area to provide 20 mini bus parking spaces, provision of hard surfaced play areas and soft landscaping (Deemed Consent)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 2559-JW-01 P04 - Existing Location Plan, 2559-JW-002 P02 - Planning, 2559-JW-101 P03 - Proposed Location Plan, 2559-JW-110 P09, Proposed Site Plan, 2559-JW-111 P06 - Proposed Ground Floor Plan, 2559-JW-112 P03 - Proposed Roof Plan, 2559-JW-114 P02 - Proposed Works to Existing Building, 2559-JW-115 P04 - Proposed Outbuildings, 2559-JW-120 P04 - Proposed North East Elevation, 2559-JW-121 P04 - Proposed North West Elevation, 2559-JW-122 P04 - Proposed South East Elevation, 2559-JW-123 P04 - Existing and Proposed South West Elevation, 2559-JW-124 P04 - Proposed North West Canopy Elevation, 2559-JW-125 P04 - Proposed South West Sectional Elevation, 2559-JW-130 P03 - Proposed Section A-A & B-B Sectional Elevation Through Pool, 2559-JW-131 P03 - Proposed Section C-C Through North West Accommodation, 2559-JW-140 P01 - Proposed Exterior Views, 2559-JW-141 P01 - Proposed Exterior View, P831858/2 - Topographical Survey Sheet 1 of 2, P831858/3  - Topographical Survey Sheet 2 of 2, CB-500-P07 - Illustrative Landscape Masterplan, CB-501 P01 - Access & Security Plan, CB-502 P01 - Illustrative Landscape Section Elevations - Sheet 1 of 2, CB-503 P01 - Illustrative Landscape Section Elevations - Sheet 2 of 2, CB-504 P01 - Landscape Hardworks, CB-505 P01 - Landscape Softworks, CB-506 - External Works - Existing to be Retained Remodelled and Removed. CB-507 P01 - Boundary Section Elevations sht 1 of 2, CB-508 P01 - Boundary Section Elevations sht 2 of 2. CB-509-P01 - Western boundary to Mini-bus Parking Area, 423613-500-C - Tracking Plan for Fire Tender, 423613-502-A - Tracking Plan for Refuse Vehicle, 423613-503-A - Tracking Plan for Mini Bus, 423613-504-A - Tracking Plan for Mini Bus, 423613-505-A - Tracking Plan for Large Car, 423613-507-A - Tracking Plan for Fire Tender, 423613-508-A - Tracking Plan for Minibus  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policy 4.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment', policy 1.1 (h) of the adopted development Plan (2012), policy 7B and Ealing Local Variation policy 7.4 of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 in the adopted London Plan (2011). | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority within 6 months of commencement of development, to demonstrate that the proposed external lighting scheme will comply with the advice given at BS 5389-1:2003, with regards to upward light and light pollution and lighting of public amenity areas and ILE guidance on Reduction of Obtrusive Lighting 2005. The lighting shall be provided in accordance with the approved details.   Lighting proposed to the staff car park area should consist of low level lighting such as bollards which will have minimal impact on adjoining residential properties.  No floodlights, permanent or removable, shall be erected on any part of the site at any time without prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To provide adequate lighting to the proposed development and protect the living conditions of neighbouring residential properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.12 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 1.1(h) of the adopted Ealing Development Strategy (2012). | The roof shall only be used for storing plant equipment, photovoltaic panels and the associated works as shown on the approved plans and shall only be accessed for the maintenance of this equipment. The roof is not be used for teaching space or any other use unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby residential properties and the safety of users of the school, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 ' Noise & Vibration', policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development Strategy (2012). | Details of any use of the schools facilities including the car park, hall, swimming pool or outdoor play areas/ courts, not directly associated with a school related event, shall be submitted in writing to the Local Authority for approval prior to the commencement of the event.  Reason: To accord with the terms of the application to allow appropriate community use of the premises outside of school hours without significant detriment to the amenities of occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.11, 8.1 and 8.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 3.16, 3.18, 7.1 and 7.15 of the adopted London Plan, 2011, policies 1.1(e) (g) (j), 1.2(d), 2.10 and 6.2 of the adopted Ealing Development Strategy (2012) and policies 7A and 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management  Development Plan Document (2013). | The extension hereby permitted shall be constructed to achieve a minimum Building Research Establishment BREEAM overall Very Good standard (based on BREEAM 2011 Technical Guidance). Within 4 weeks of commencement of the development, evidence that the development is registered with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) under the BREEAM 2011 New Construction Scheme and an Interim Design Stage BREEAM 2011 NC Assessment has been submitted for information/review to the Local Planning Authority. Within 6 months of the date of commencement a BREEAM Interim Design Stage Certificate for the development has to be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.    The extension shall not be occupied until a BREEAM 'Post Construction Stage' Assessment has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for information/review, confirming that the agreed sustainability measures will be achieved.  Within 3 months from the date of first occupation of the development a Post-Construction Stage Certificate verified by the BRE will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming the BREEAM standard and measures have been implemented.   Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the extension element of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM Very Good standard shall be retained in working order in perpetuity.     Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2011, policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan policy 5.2 of the Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Prior to the commencement of the development, other than site preparation works, site remediation or the formation of accesses, an Energy Strategy, which includes full details and drawings of the sustainability measures that are to be incorporated into the development, shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The submitted details shall demonstrate that the development hereby approved will achieve an overall minimum reduction in carbon dioxide emissions by 40% over Building Regulations 2010, or the relevant Building Regulations and London Plan Climate Change policies at the time of the submission, unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority. The Energy Strategy should be based on the provision of a single plant room serving the development which will be future proofed to allow connection to decentralised energy network(s) off-site.   In demonstrating compliance with this percentage reduction the applicant should consider the use of measures in line with the Energy Hierarchy including the incorporation of on-site renewables.  This reduction should be calculated based on carbon dioxide emissions covered by the Building Regulations only (regulated) whilst carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (un-regulated) should be also included and measures to reduce them should be demonstrated.  Energy Performance Certificates [EPC's] and modelling output reports from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures should be also submitted for written approval by the Local Authority.  The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved details and maintained as such thereafter.  Reason:  To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, in accordance with policies 5.2 Minimise Carbon dioxide Emissions, 5.3 Sustainable Design and Construction, 5.6 Decentralised Energy: Heating, Cooling and Power and 5.7 Renewable Energy of the London Plan 2011, policies 1.1(a) and 1.2 (f) of Ealing's adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (2012). | Upon final completion of the development and prior to first occupation, suitable devices for the monitoring of the renewable/low-carbon energy equipment shall be installed. The monitored data shall be submitted to the local planning authority at daily intervals for a period of three years from final completion. The installation of the monitoring devices should be in a compatible format and the submission of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications as indicated in the Automated Energy (& CO2) Monitoring Platform [AEMP] document.   Reason: To monitor the effectiveness of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment in order to confirm compliance with energy policies and establish an evidence base on the performance of such equipment in accordance policies 1.1(h), & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy LV 5.2 of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013),  policies  5.1-5.7 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The new car park at the Eastern end of the site, including the associated access, disabled parking, the provision of 4 electric charging points and the infrastructure for the future provision of 4 electric charging points, shall be laid out and completed in accordance with the details indicated on the submitted drawings prior to the first occupation of any part of the extension hereby permitted and shall not be used by more than 22 cars and used only by the school. Except on weekday evenings or day at the weekend when school events are held, the car park shall be vacated and closed by 18-30 and there shall be no use of this car park at the weekend, except in conjunction with any school event.   Reason : To accord with the terms of the application, to provide adequate parking in conjunction with the use of the school and in the interests of the amenities of occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 6.13 , 7.1, 7.2, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.15 of the adopted London Plan (2011), policies 1.1(f), 1.1(h), 1.1(j), 1.1(k), 1.2(k) and 2.10 of the adopted Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 4.1, 4.3 , 4.11, and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004) and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan policies 6.13 and 7.4 and policy 7A of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The submitted Travel Plan shall be implemented at the time of first occupation of the development and shall be permanently retained in operation thereafter.  Reason: To promote the use of modes of transport, other than use of private motor vehicles, in pursuance of policy 6.3 in the adopted London Plan (2011). policy 1.1(f) of the adopted Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policy 9.1 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004),  the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance, SPG 21 'Sustainable Transport: Green Travel Plans'. | Notwithstanding the detail shown on the approved drawings, full details of the hard and soft landscaping and boundary treatment along the western boundary (to the rear of Hathaway Gardens), shall be submitted within 4 months of the commencement of the development hereby permitted and the approved details shall be completed within the 4 months of the substantial completion of the extension hereby approved. Any trees or other shrubs which within 5 years of planting die, are removed, or become seriously damaged, or diseased, shall be replaced within the next planting season with other of the same species and size, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the local planning authority.   Reason : To provide suitable landscaping in the interests of the visual and residential amenity and character of the area and to enhance the biodiversity of the area in accordance with policies 5.10, 7.1, 7.4, 7.6, 7.19 and 7.21 of the adopted London Plan (2011), policies 1.1(h)  and (i) of the adopted Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 4.1 and 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004) and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan policies 5.10 and 7.4 in the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) | The tree protection details included within the submitted Arboricultural Impact Assessment shall be in place prior to any other work being undertaken within the site and be retained in place at all times until the development has been completed and the areas so enclosed shall not be used for any form of storage and shall not have their levels altered.   Reason : To safeguard these existing trees and the contribution they make to the visual amenity of the area in accordance with policies 5.10, 7.1, 7.4, 7.6, 7.19 and 7.21 of the adopted London Plan (2011), policies 1.1(h)  and (i) of the adopted Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 4.1 and 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004) and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan policies 5.10 and 7.4 in the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) |  Any externally audible plant provided in conjunction with the development hereby approved shall demonstrate that the rating noise level emitted, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.  Reason: In the interests of protecting the amenity of staff and students and other visitors to the site and the occupiers of the neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7.15 of the adopted London Plan (2011), policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Strategy (2012 and policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | The development shall be undertaken in accordance with the Construction Method Statement submitted with the application and any changes to this Statement shall be agreed in writing with the local planning authority. Details of the works to the crown of any trees that may be affected by the movement of construction traffic shall be agreed with the local planning authority.   Reason: To safeguard the amenities of occupiers of neighbouring occupiers, the amenities of the locality and in the interests of the safety and movement of traffic, pedestrians and other users of the local highway network in accordance with policies 6.11 and 7.15 of the adopted London Plan (2011), policies 1.1(f) and (j) of the adopted Ealing Development Strategy (2012) and adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) policies 4.1, 4.11 and 9.1. | Security measures, including the closed circuit television, shall comply with the principles of 'Secured by Design'.   Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates crime prevention measures to help prevent crime and disorder to safeguard the school and amenities of occupiers of neighbouring properties. In accordance with policy 7.3 in the adopted London Plan (2011), policies 4.1, & 4.3 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1 (h) of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), Ealing Local Variation to London Plan policy 7.3 of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Details of a surface water and foul water drainage scheme based on sustainable drainage principles shall be submitted to and approved, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved and the development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To ensure the drainage measures comply with Thames Water/Environment Agency requirements, and to prevent the increased risk of flooding in accordance with section 10 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 5.12, 5.13 and 5.14 of the London Plan 2011,  policies 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (m) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026,  policy 2.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004) and Local Variation to London Plan  policy 5.12 of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The swimming pool shall only be emptied into the public sewer overnight, or in dry periods and the rate of discharge shall not exceed a flow rate of 5 litres per second.   Reason : To prevent the risk of flooding or surcharging to the public sewer in accordance with section 10 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 5.12, 5.13 and 5.14 of the London Plan 2011,  policies 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (m) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026,  policy 2.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004) and Local Variation to London Plan  policy 5.12 of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
